feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 9:01AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Water level rises expected from the release of the Valdez Glacier Dam Lake... Valdez Glacier Dam Lake appears to be releasing as the Valdez Glacier River is beginning to rise rapidly. Water levels on the Valdez Glacier River can be expected to rise approximately 3 feet over the next 24-36 hours as the glacier dam releases. Additional

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:02PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Heavy rain in the Brooks Range several days ago is causing high water and some flooding on the Upper Koyukuk River. The lower Koyukuk river will rise over the next several days and crest at Huslia on Wednesday or Thursday. Water levels will remain high as Huslia from Wednesday through next weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Fortymile River Through Monday... The Fortymile River saw very sharp rises in the river Saturday night and Sunday from heavy rain that fell on Saturday. No flooding was reported, but the river got high and covered some gravel bars. There will be lots of logs and other debris coming down the river.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Chandalar River Through Monday... High water is now moving down the Chandalar River from heavy rain and heavy snowmelt in the Brooks Range several days ago. This high water will move downstream into the Yukon Flats tonight and Monday and could cause water to rise. Water will cover gravel bars and there will be lots of logs and other debris coming down

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 12 at 11:03AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA TUESDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Tuesday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.summary: ...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN TODAY AND TUESDAY... * Numerous showers and thunderstorms are expected today with only a slight decrease in coverage Tuesday. entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL ELBERT COUNTY... In north central Wyoming, Johnson and Washakie. * WHEN...Until 330 PM MDT.

In north central Wyoming, Johnson and Washakie. * WHEN...Until 330 PM MDT.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 12 at 1:50AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Wyoming, including the following areas, Central Laramie County, Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County, East Laramie County, Laramie Valley, South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 11:32AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .High-elevation snowmelt, with snowpack remaining above 9,500 feet, continues. However, the lower elevation snowpack feeding the tributaries of the Bear River has largely melted. Therefore, flows

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 11:29AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER
